FuncDef:
The te auto-primary-tunnel command enables a device to collect traffic statistics on tunnels established using PCE path calculation.
The undo te auto-primary-tunnel command disables a device from collecting traffic statistics on tunnels established using PCE path calculation.
By default, the function is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates an RSVP-TE tunnel whose establishment is triggered by PCEP.
-

Indicates an SR-MPLS TE tunnel whose establishment is triggered by PCEP.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
PCEP-triggered automatic tunnels are not manually configured. To view traffic statistics on such tunnels, run the te auto-primary-tunnel command. PCEP can trigger the establishment of RSVP-TE and SR-MPLS TE tunnels:
To collect traffic statistics on RSVP-TE tunnels, run the te auto-primary-tunnel pce-initiated-lsp command.To collect traffic statistics on SR-MPLS TE tunnels, run the te auto-primary-tunnel segment-routing command.

Prerequisites
MPLS has been enabled globally using the MPLS command.
